page.title: 07LANGUAGE
page.content: The language Welsh (Cymraeg) is the speech of the Celts who are believed to have come to Britain about 400B.C. In 1901 930,000 people spoke Welsh.Today only about 500,000 speak Welsh.In Conwy 31% of people speak Welsh: a decrease of 4% from 1971.But in Henryd,52% of people speak Welsh:an increase of 4%. In Wales we are lucky to have the Eisteddfod which gives young people a taste of Welsh.About 45,000 people compete.43% of people between 5-15years speak Welsh in Aberconwy. RYDW I'N GOBEITHIO EICH BOD CHI WEDI MWYNHAU DARLLEN HWN. I HOPED YOU HAVE ENJOYED READING THIS. Dylan Williams.
